You want to become

a great

keeper

and shine

on the pitch ?
Home.description1:
Join our Academy and boost

your skills with our experienced coaches!

Learn with Vincent Vanasch!

Ready for excellence?
Home.description2:
Camps all summer!

Blue Lions & Royal Or√©e

61 Hertswegenstraat, 3080 Tervuren &

Avenue Edmond Galoppin 1150 Woluwe-Saint-Pierre

Carousel.captionSarah:
Vincent Vanasch is the best goalkeeper in the world!

I was lucky enough to participate in his training course

and I learned some incredible tricks

to block shots!

Now I'm ready

to become a champion myself!
Carousel.captionChris:
It's amazing what I learned.

It was really great.

By far the best week

of the year!
Carousel.captionThomas:
The Wall Academy

was an incredible experience for me.

I improved my reflexes,

my stopping techniques

and learned to communicate

better with my team.
Carousel.captionCamille:
The coaches were really great

and gave me individual advice

on how to improve my performance.

I highly recommend this course

to all keepers!
Carousel.captionCeline:
I was lucky to have coaches

who taught me how to position my body well,

to better understand angles

and to better anticipate opposing shots.
Carousel.captionHugo:
I took part in the hockey course

especially for goalkeepers

with Vincent Vanasch and I learned a lot!

Now I am the wall of my little team,

and my friends call me "the brick wall"!

WhatIsItems.atelierDescription: Discover the secrets of champions through special workshops.
WhatIsItems.wallDescription: Meet Vincent Vanasch and get advice from the Olympic champion.
WhatIsItems.videoDescription: Benefit from the expertise of the best in the business with our in-depth video analysis sessions!
WhatIsItems.experienceDescription: Enjoy a unique experience by participating in an elite course organised by the best goalkeeper in the world.
WhatIsItems.smallGroupDescription: A limited number of keepers ensures that everyone receives high quality attention and coaching.
WhatIsItems.staffDescription: Take advantage of an experienced goalkeeper training team that will provide you with relevant and expert technical advice.
WhatIsItems.coachingDescription: Talk to the team in personalised coaching sessions dedicated to your progress.
WhatIsItems.concentrationDescription: Benefit from recommendations to strengthen your concentration and confidence.

hero.subtitle: Belgian international goalkeeper, nicknamed The Wall. Olympic champion and three-time FIH Goalkeeper of the Year.
mottos: Work hard in silence, let success make the noise.
Talent wins games, the team wins titles.

story.intro: Trained at Royal Evere White Star, Vincent Vanasch built his path step by step before becoming one of the top field hockey goalkeepers of his generation.
story.body: Olympic champion and three-time FIH Goalkeeper of the Year, he has more than 280 caps with the Red Lions. In Tokyo 2020, Belgium captured its first men's Olympic title thanks to his decisive shoot-out saves.

items.title: International goalkeeper
items.body: Over 280 caps with the Red Lions.

items.title: The Wall
items.body: Three-time FIH Goalkeeper of the Year.

items.title: Olympic gold
items.body: Tokyo 2020, decisive saves in the shoot-outs.

items.title: Leadership
items.body: Reference goalkeeper, mentor and role model.

items.name: Royal Evere White Star
items.detail: Formative club where it all began.

items.name: Oranje-Zwart / Oranje-Rood
items.detail: Two Dutch titles (2015, 2016) and the EHL (2015).

items.name: Waterloo Ducks
items.detail: EHL 2019, first title for a Belgian club.

items.name: Royal Or?e
items.detail: Return in 2023 for a three-year contract.

items.name: Soorma Hockey Club
items.detail: Played in the Hero Hockey India League.

book.paragraph1: Three-time Belgian champion, three-time German champion, two-time Dutch champion, two-time European club champion, then European champion, world champion and Olympic champion with the Red Lions: everything in Vincent Vanasch's career seems simple, beautiful and grand. Yet for the man they would call The Wall, the wall was not built in a day. "Too big", "too small", "too mentally fragile": nothing was guaranteed. In his career there were more defeats than victories. But driven by passion, supported by his teammates and galvanized by skeptics, he laid every brick patiently, collectively, on one cement: family and friends. In this sensitive autobiography, "Vinchou" shares the secrets and doubts that marked his journey from the White Star family club to the Olympic gold in Tokyo. On the double-decker bus that takes the national team from the airport to the center of Brussels to meet thousands of fans, Vincent Vanasch takes the time to remember every step and every person who mattered. How did the Red Lions learn to win? How can a kid from Evere become three-time world goalkeeper of the year? Vincent Vanasch takes you on this magnificent bus ride. Enjoy.
book.paragraph2: Vincent revisits every step, from White Star to Olympic gold, and explains how the Red Lions learned to win.
